intro: Brunsvigia natalensis, commonly known as the Natal onion or Natal star, is a bulbous plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking, star-shaped flowers that bloom in summer. The plant features strap-like leaves and produces clusters of white or pale pink flowers. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in well-drained soils. Brunsvigia natalensis is also known for its resilience and ability to store water in its underground bulbs.
